thread.title: 'An angry Ferrero Rocher': CeeLo Green's bizarre Grammys outfit explained
thread.title_full: 'An angry Ferrero Rocher': CeeLo Green's bizarre Grammys outfit explained

author: Mark Molloy
title: 'An angry Ferrero Rocher': CeeLo Green's bizarre Grammys outfit explained
text:
'An angry Ferrero Rocher': CeeLo Green's bizarre Grammys outfit explained Meet Gnarly Davidson: CeeLo Green's Grammys outfit caused a stir Credit: Getty Mark Molloy 13 February 2017 ‚Ä¢ 10:15am 
O ne of the most bizarre sights on the Grammys red carpet was signer CeeLo Green dressed, as one Twitter user put it, ‚Äúan angry Ferrero Rocher‚Äù. 
Dressing up as a popular spherical chocolate treat isn‚Äôt exactly a classic red carpet look and the rapper and record producer‚Äôs outfit certainly created a stir online. CeeLo Green as Gnarly Davidson Credit: EPA Watch | Ten of the strangest Grammy Awards outfits 01:21 
S o why exactly was CeeLo Green dressed like a shiny gold Tin Man? Well, it was all to do with his new ‚Äòpersona‚Äô- Gnarly Davidson . CeeLo Green Credit: Getty His futuristic mask and gold tunic outfit sparked a host of jokes on Twitter: FYI: CeeLo Green will be going by CeeLo Gold tonight at the #GRAMMYs . pic.twitter.com/WjD7yn2dh6 ‚Äî CeeLo Green (@CeeLoGreen) February 13, 2017 Why is CeeLo Green dressed like a Ferrero Rocher üòÇüíÄ #GRAMMYs pic.twitter.com/Cx63rr77Qg ‚Äî Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) February 13, 2017 Cee Lo Green out here looking like Goldust #GRAMMYs pic.twitter.com/fQJFCtFhvV ‚Äî Ryan Belk (@rbelk_94) February 13, 2017 when you're *really* sick of someone else showing up in the same outfit pic.twitter.com/AvdeoTMIYj ‚Äî MTV News (@MTVNews) February 13, 2017 Cee-Lo showed up looking like an angry Ferrero Rocher. pic.twitter.com/bNMf8s9HRv 
A dele was the big winner of the night, picking up five gongs . On stage she paid tribute to her 'idol' Beyonce. 
"I can't possibly accept this award," she said. 
"I'm very humble and I'm grateful and gracious but my artist of my life is Beyonce and the Lemonade album was just so monumental - Beyonce, it was so monumental - and so well thought out and so beautiful and soul-bearing. 
"All us artists here, we f g adore you. 
"The way you make me and my friends feel. The way you make my black friends feel is empowering. You make them stand up for themselves and I love you and I always have."
